application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: 132 Cherry: Remove damaged limb at 3m214 Cherry: Fell due to condition218 Holly: Fell to accommodate new hedging and improvements to planting bed223 Holly: Fell to accommodate improvements to planting bed229 Holly: Fell to accommodate new hedging and improvements to planting bed230 Holly: Coppice to allow more light to improve planting bed and to encourage quality regenerative growth of Holly231 Apple: Fell to accommodate improvements to planting bed 235 Holly: Fell to accommodate improvements to planting bed  and to improve growing conditions for 234 False Acacia. 241 Silver Birch: Fell due to poor future prospects.1310 Common Ash: Overall crown reduction by up to 2.5m to suitable growth points to reduce the weight and load above the areas of decay.1365 Cedar 'Glauca': Fell due to poor future prospects and to accommodate new improvements to planting bed  TG24 Group of Holly: Fell 211 and 213 to accommodate new hedging and improvements to planting bed  TG25 Group of Holly: Coppice 130 and 134 to allow more light to planting bed and to encourage quality regenerative growth of Hollies.  TG27 Group of Western Red Cedar: Fell 225 and 226 to accommodate new hedging and improvements to planting bed TG28 Group of Cherry Laurel :Fell group to accommodate new hedging and improvements to planting bed  TG30 Mixed Species Group :Coppice 263, 265, 292, 280, 283 and 288 to allow more light to improve planting bed and to encourage quality regenerative growth of hollies
